teams.name: Amazons
teams.description: In the jungles of Lustria, Amazon teams are squads of warrior women with perfect super-athlete physiques for Blood Bowl. Their innate agility allows them to run through defenses, dodging without giving opponents a chance to react.

teams.name: Black Orcs
teams.description: Black Orcs are the biggest and strongest of all Orcs. They prefer to form their own teams focused on brute force and violence, employing Goblins to handle the ball while they smash heads.

special_rules.name: Brawlin' Brutes
special_rules.description: During a league, this team earns SPP differently: Players earn 3 SPP for causing a Casualty (instead of 2), but only 2 SPP for scoring a Touchdown (instead of 3).

special_rules.name: Bribery and Corruption
special_rules.description: Once per match, when this team rolls a 1 when Arguing the Call, you may re-roll the die.

teams.name: Bretonnians
teams.description: Bretonnian teams are composed of noble Knights who seek glory and peasant Yeomen and Linemen who serve them. They are known for their courage and their unique playstyle involving specialized Knights.

teams.name: Chaos Dwarfs
teams.description: Twisted descendants of Dwarves who utilize Hobgoblin slaves and mutated Bull Centaurs to dominate the pitch with armor and violence.

special_rules.name: Favoured of Hashut
special_rules.description: This team is aligned with Hashut. Some Star Players with 'Favoured of...' can only play for teams with this specific alignment.

teams.name: Chaos Renegades
teams.description: A collection of misfits and outcasts from other races who have turned to the Chaos Gods. They are a mix of players including Humans, Orcs, Goblins, Skaven, Dark Elves, and multiple Big Guys.

special_rules.name: Favoured of...
special_rules.description: When creating the team roster, this team must choose an alignment from: Hashut, Khorne, Nurgle, Slaanesh, Tzeentch, or Chaos Undivided. Once chosen, it cannot be changed. Some Star Players with 'Favoured of...' can only play for teams with a specific alignment.

teams.name: Gnomes
teams.description: Gnomes are small, magical creatures who use illusions and woodland animals to compete. They are tougher than they look and rely on wrestling to bring down larger opponents.

teams.name: Chaos Chosen
teams.description: Blood Bowl is phenomenally popular among followers of Chaos. Most Chaos teams are made up of Beastmen, reinforced by Chosen humans who have been selected by the forces of Chaos, along with Minotaurs, Ogres and Trolls.

teams.name: Dark Elves
teams.description: Cruel and athletic, Dark Elves combine speed with viciousness. Their players are known for their ruthless approach to the game.

teams.name: Dwarfs
teams.description: Slow but incredibly tough, Dwarfs are masters of the grind game. Their players are known for their Block and Tackle skills.

teams.name: Elven Union
teams.description: Graceful and agile, Elves play a beautiful passing game. They are known for their speed and ball-handling skills.

teams.name: Goblins
teams.description: Goblins are small, sneaky and love using Secret Weapons. What they lack in strength they make up for with dirty tricks and sheer numbers.

special_rules.name: Bribery and Corruption
special_rules.description: Once per match, when this team rolls a 1 when Arguing the Call, you may re-roll the die.

teams.name: Halflings
teams.description: Halflings are small, slow, and not very strong, but they make up for it with Treemen allies and lots of enthusiasm. They are known for their ability to be thrown by Treemen.

teams.name: High Elves
teams.description: High Elves are the most arrogant of all Elves, but their skill on the Blood Bowl field backs up their attitude. They excel at the passing game.

teams.name: Humans
teams.description: The most balanced team in Blood Bowl, Humans can do a bit of everything. They have good options for running, passing, and blocking.

teams.name: Imperial Nobility
teams.description: The nobles of the Empire bring their wealth and bodyguards to the Blood Bowl pitch. They field a mix of skilled nobles and tough Ogre bodyguards.

teams.name: Khorne
teams.description: Dedicated to the Blood God, Khorne teams are all about violence and aggression. They have no interest in subtlety or finesse.

special_rules.name: Favoured of Khorne
special_rules.description: This team is aligned with Khorne, the Blood God. Some Star Players with 'Favoured of...' can only play for teams with this specific alignment.

teams.name: Lizardmen
teams.description: Cold-blooded killers combining speed and raw power. Skinks handle the ball while Saurus provide the muscle.

teams.name: Necromantic Horror
teams.description: Necromantic teams combine various undead creatures raised by powerful necromancers. They feature Werewolves, Flesh Golems, and other horrors.

special_rules.name: Masters of Undeath
special_rules.description: Once per match, if an opposing player with ST 4 or less without the Stunty trait suffers a Dead result on the Injury table, this team may Raise the Dead and immediately add a Lineman from their team list to their Reserves box. This may temporarily give the team more than 16 players. The raised player can be permanently hired for free after the match if the roster has space.

teams.name: Norse
teams.description: Vikings who bring their berserker fury to the Blood Bowl pitch. They hit hard but aren't the most heavily armored.

teams.name: Nurgle
teams.description: Blessed by the Plague God, Nurgle teams spread disease and decay wherever they go. They are tough but slow.

special_rules.name: Favoured of Nurgle
special_rules.description: This team is aligned with Nurgle, the Plague God. Some Star Players with 'Favoured of...' can only play for teams with this specific alignment.

teams.name: Ogres
teams.description: Teams of massive Ogres backed up by tiny Gnoblars. The Ogres do the hitting while the Gnoblars try not to get stepped on.

teams.name: Old World Alliance
teams.description: A coalition of Humans, Dwarfs, and Halflings working together. They combine the strengths of each race.

teams.name: Orcs
teams.description: Tough and brutal, Orcs excel at the hitting game but lack finesse. They have good blockers and blitzers.

teams.name: Shambling Undead
teams.description: An army of the dead, tough and expendable. Skeletons and Zombies backed up by Wights and Mummies.

special_rules.name: Masters of Undeath
special_rules.description: Once per match, if an opposing player with ST 4 or less without the Stunty trait suffers a Dead result on the Injury table, this team may Raise the Dead and immediately add a Lineman from their team list to their Reserves box. This may temporarily give the team more than 16 players. The raised player can be permanently hired for free after the match if the roster has space.

teams.name: Skaven
teams.description: Lightning fast but fragile, Skaven rely on speed and trickery. Their Gutter Runners are among the fastest players in the game.

teams.name: Snotlings
teams.description: The smallest and weakest team in Blood Bowl. Snotlings make up for their terrible stats with large numbers and fun secret weapons.

special_rules.name: Bribery and Corruption
special_rules.description: Once per match, when this team rolls a 1 when Arguing the Call, you may re-roll the die.

special_rules.name: Low Cost Linemen
special_rules.description: In a league, when calculating this team's current Team Value, the hiring cost of their Linemen is considered to be 0 gold pieces. Add any value increases normally.

teams.name: Tomb Kings
teams.description: Ancient undead from the desert lands. Tomb Kings teams feature Skeleton players backed by powerful Tomb Guardians.

special_rules.name: Masters of Undeath
special_rules.description: Once per match, if an opposing player with ST 4 or less without the Stunty trait suffers a Dead result on the Injury table, this team may Raise the Dead and immediately add a Lineman from their team list to their Reserves box. This may temporarily give the team more than 16 players. The raised player can be permanently hired for free after the match if the roster has space.

teams.name: Underworld Denizens
teams.description: A mix of Skaven and Goblins from the tunnels beneath the Old World. They work together despite their mutual distrust.

special_rules.name: Bribery and Corruption
special_rules.description: Once per match, when this team rolls a 1 when Arguing the Call, you may re-roll the die.

teams.name: Vampires
teams.description: Vampires are among the best players in Blood Bowl, with supernatural speed, strength, and agility. However, their bloodlust can be their downfall.

special_rules.name: Masters of Undeath
special_rules.description: Once per match, if an opposing player with ST 4 or less without the Stunty trait suffers a Dead result on the Injury table, this team may Raise the Dead and immediately add a Lineman from their team list to their Reserves box. This may temporarily give the team more than 16 players. The raised player can be permanently hired for free after the match if the roster has space.

teams.name: Wood Elves
teams.description: The fastest team in the game, masters of the one-turn touchdown. Natural talents at dodging with Wardancers providing key blocks.
